segments.text: My attention keeps going back to the overflowing sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just relentlessly pouring over the edge.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's a continuous sheet, drenching the cabinets and forming a wide puddle on the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And yet, the woman doesn't react at all.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is literally in the water, but her face shows nothing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I find it somewhat unsettling, this complete lack of awareness.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The thought of water damage and a slippery floor is quite unpleasant.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can someone be so absorbed they miss such an obvious problem?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's almost a metaphor for something deeper, this domestic chaos unnoticed.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish I could just reach in and turn the faucet off for her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole situation is making me feel quite uneasy.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The pristine garden outside only emphasizes the mess inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's a rather gross waste of water too, in this day and age.
segments.speaker: PAR
